channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Boeing’s jets turn 70: A timeline of highs, lows and turbulence
item.description: Boeing, founded in 1916, has experienced good times and bad during its more than 100 years in the air.

item.title: EU signs off on sweeping migration overhaul ahead of elections
item.description: New Pact on Migration and Asylum approval comes as EU prepares to hold elections in which migration could be pivotal.

item.title: Japan’s famous brother-and-sister act eye more Olympic judo gold
item.description: Three years after the Tokyo Olympics, Japan's Hifumi Abe and his sister Uta want to go for gold again in Paris Olympics.

item.title: Russian corruption probe widens as senior defence official arrested
item.description: Yuri Kuznetsov, the second senior official arrested in the case, is accused of bribery after being found holding $1m.

item.title: Russia’s Putin to visit China in first foreign trip since re-election
item.description: The Russian leader's May 16-17 visit aims to underscore the deepening 'no limits' partnership with China's Xi Jinping.

item.title: Russia’s defence rejig: ‘Unfortunately for Ukraine, a very effective move’
item.description: Analysts predict Andrei Belousov will boost Russia's military-industrial complex as Kyiv's forces struggle on the front.

item.title: Unrest wracks French Pacific territory of New Caledonia
item.description: Authorities impose an overnight curfew and ban gatherings after violent unrest in the capital, Noumea.

item.title: Gaza ceasefire deadlocked as Israel’s Rafah attacks set talks ‘backward’
item.description: Qatar says mediation efforts are being hampered by Israel’s offensive on Gaza’s southern city.

item.title: Palestinians mark 76 years of Nakba as new tragedy unfolds in Gaza
item.description: The Nakba is at the core of the Palestinian struggle, but in many ways pales in comparison to Israel's war on Gaza.

item.title: Israeli forces attacked ‘known aid worker locations’ in Gaza: Rights group
item.description: Human Rights Watch says aid workers' convoys and facilities have been targeted at least eight times since last October.

item.title: A UN resolution on the Srebrenica genocide ignites old tensions
item.description: Leaders from Serbia and Bosnia's Republika Srpska have been campaigning against the adoption of a UN resolution.

item.title: Bangladesh’s T20 World Cup squad: Shakib named in Shanto-led side
item.description: The 37-year-old all-rounder has played 36 matches in all previous editions of the tournament from 2007 to 2022.

item.title: Melinda French Gates resigns as Gates Foundation co-chair, gets $12.5bn
item.description: French Gates says she will exit with $12.5bn for her own charity work to uplift women and families.

item.title: Number of internally displaced people hit record 75.9 million in 2023
item.description: Report says 7.7 million people displaced by disasters and 68.3 million by conflict and violence last year.

item.title: Unrest in Pakistan-administered Kashmir: What’s behind the recent protests?
item.description: Why are the residents of Pakistan-administered Kashmir out on the streets and what are their demands?

item.title: Paris 2024: China gives table tennis legend Ma another shot at Olympic gold
item.description: Ma Long's inclusion in China's table tennis squad gives him a chance to win gold in his fourth consecutive Olympics.

item.title: Kazakhstan jails former minister for 24 years over wife’s torture, murder
item.description: United Nations says about 400 women die from domestic violence in Kazakhstan each year, but many cases go unreported.

item.title: Army officer resigns due to US support for Israel’s war in Gaza
item.description: 'Shame and guilt' drove Major Harrison Mann to quit in November, but he was 'afraid' of expressing it earlier.

item.title: At least 14 killed as billboard collapses in Mumbai during thunderstorm
item.description: The billboard collapsed on some houses and a petrol station next to a busy road in the eastern suburb of Ghatkopar.

item.title: ‘Unbearable’: Will 45C heatwaves affect who India chooses in election?
item.description: Candidates are fainting, voter turnout is lower, and research suggests extreme heat could influence who people choose.

item.title: NBA playoffs: Celtics take 3-1 lead, Thunder level series with Mavericks
item.description: Celtics surged ahead of the Cavs with a 109-102 win as LeBron James watched on at his old stomping ground.

item.title: US promises Ukraine military aid to make ‘real difference’ on the way
item.description: Ukraine's president lauds arrival of 'crucial' US aid as Antony Blinken makes surprise trip to Kyiv.

item.title: Australian war crimes whistleblower David McBride jailed for six years
item.description: Eight years after Australia began investigating war crimes in Afghanistan, a whistleblower is the first to be punished.

item.title: New Caledonia: Security forces deployed, curfew imposed amid Noumea unrest
item.description: Buildings and cars torched after protest against constitutional amendments descended into unrest

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 810
item.description: As the war enters its 810th day, these are the main developments.
